method (e.g. classification, detection, localization, interpretation, etc.) o neural networks have an innate ability to learn invariant models, given suitable examples o small rotations or shifts of an image do not (generally) change its nature, nor its class o adding rescaled, rotated, or shifted versions of actual images is one way of adding prior knowledge data augmentation what is it about data augmentation stochastic process of generating new artificial images, which recreate different scales, orientations and shifts of real images, without losing their nature data augmentation
